channel.title: Indonesia on Alien Truth Social

item.title: UFO sightings in Indonesia
item.description:
List of Alleged UFO Sightings within Indonesia ðŸ”—

This section presents a chronological list of reported UFO sightings in various locations across Indonesia. Each entry includes the city or region, the specific island or province, and the date of the alleged sighting, along with citations for verification.

  • Early Sightings (1953-1964): The earliest reported sightings occurred in Medan, Sumatra (January 28, 1953, and June 26, 1955), Malang, Java (February 21, 1953), Gorontalo, Sulawesi (February 23, 1953), Alor Island, East Nusa Tenggara (July 1959), Jakarta (1962), Surabaya, East Java (1964), and Yogyakarta, Yogyakarta Special Region (1964).
  • Sightings in the 1970s: Sightings were reported in Mount Agung, Bali (1973), and Jakarta (October 7, 1977, and November 11, 1977).
  • Sightings in the 1980s and 1990s: Sightings were reported in Yogyakarta, Yogyakarta Special Region (1980), Tarakan Island, East Kalimantan (1984), Jakarta (1986), Bandung, West Java (1989), Bali (1991), Probolinggo, East Java (1994), Salatiga, Central Java (July 1995 and September 1997), and Pengandonan (February 1996).
  • Sightings from 1998 to 2011: Sightings were reported in Mount Salak, West Java (April 16, 1998), Denpasar, Bali (February 3, 2000), Salatiga, Central Java (October 12, 2003), and Seminyak, Bali (March 18, 2011).

See also ðŸ”—

This section provides links to related Wikipedia articles. These include a general list of reported UFO sightings and a specific list of UFO sightings in Australia.

References ðŸ”—

This section lists the sources cited in the article. These references include news articles, websites, and books that provide information about the reported UFO sightings in Indonesia. The references are formatted as footnotes, with links to the original sources where available.

source: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/UFO_sightings_in_Indonesia
